definition: momentary slip/false step/ill-considered action
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
(possessive particle, literary equivalent of 的[de5])/him/her/it
difference/discrepancy/to differ/error/to err/to make a mistake
to differ from/to fall short of/lacking/wrong/inferior/Taiwan pr. [cha1]
to send/to commission/messenger/mission

sentences.english: Successis often just the right idea away.
sentences.chinese: 勝利與否通常只是一念之差。

sentences.english: Success is often just an idea away.
sentences.chinese: 成功與否往往只是一念之差。

sentences.english: Successes and failures, rich and poor is only the ages.
sentences.chinese: 成功與失敗，富有與貧窮只不過是一念之差。

sentences.english: A slight error in thought may constitute a life-long regret.
One wrong thought may cause a lifelong regret.
sentences.chinese: 一念之差可能造成終身悔恨。

sentences.english: There is a thin line between being a hero and being a memory.
sentences.chinese: 成爲英雄和成爲回憶僅僅是一念之差。

sentences.english: He's held up humiliation by a momentary slip.
sentences.chinese: 他因一念之差而蒙受屈辱。

sentences.english: I just had a moment of weakness.
Beauty to me is being comfortable in your own skin.
sentences.chinese: 覺得一個人美麗還是醜，只是一念之差。

sentences.english: One wrong think may cause a lifelong regret.
Success is often an idea away.
sentences.chinese: 成功與否往往只是一念之差。

sentences.english: Successis often just a thought off of.
sentences.chinese: 得勝與否不時只是一念之差。

sentences.english: How far is it between obtaining and offering? Perhaps just the difference of an idea.
sentences.chinese: 索取與奉獻之間有多遠，也許就只是一念之差吧。

definition: to make a serious mistake (idiom)
a single slip may cause everlasting sorrow (idiom)
pinyin: yi1 shi1 zu2 cheng2 qian1 gu3 hen4

definition: consigned to eternal damnation/with no hope of reprieve
to regret one's past deeds (idiom)
blunder
to take a wrong step in life (idiom)/to go astray
to lose one's head through material greed (idiom)
to forfeit (future profit, one's life etc)/ruined
to repeat errors/to continue blundering/to make continuous mistakes
see 一著不慎，滿盤皆輸|一着不慎，满盘皆输[yi1 zhao1 bu4 shen4 , man3 pan2 jie1 shu1]
too late for regrets (idiom); It is useless to repent after the event.
to be obsessed/to be possessed
to repent
irreversible
lit. to get shackled and thrown in jail (idiom)/fig. to be put behind bars/to get jailed
to eat one's own fruit (idiom); fig. suffering the consequences of one's own action/to reap what one has sown
